metadata.synopsis: Libidinous Hogan (Jack Lemmon) is a landlord who prefers to rent his rooms to attractive single females. Hogan is instantly smitten with a pretty new tenant named Robin (Carol Lynley), but realizes that he'll have to contend with Robin's boyfriend, David (Dean Jones), if he's to attain the object of his desire. He gets his opportunity when he learns that the couple's living arrangement is a pre-marital experiment to see if they would be compatible as partners when sex is out of the equation.

reviews: As engineered by director David Swift, the film's cardinal error is its lack of restraint.
A gay and amusing light comedy.
An indulgent movie that was slightly too late to catch the "sex-comedy" trend begun by the Doris Day-Rock Hudson pictures.
David Swift has directed it to move fast. The color and the music are a little loud. Tired businessmen should love it. Teenagers should stay in school.
Even with Lemmon bouncing in and out of comic situations, the comedy gets a little strained at times.
